intro: Pedicularis carpatica, commonly known as the Carpathian lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually erect and branched. Pedicularis carpatica is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils, often found in rocky or alpine environments.
